sentences.english: Opportunities exist for Wis-Mpower to continue with its current strdinedgy of large- super centres.
sentences.chinese: 沃尔玛的机缘存在于对现有大型超市战略的对峙。

sentences.english: Life is a long journey, challenges keep pace with opportunites during this journey.
sentences.chinese: 生命是一场短途游览，在旅途上有应战和机缘。

sentences.english: Then one thing led to another and now I am a news anchor myself.
sentences.chinese: 就这样，机缘巧合的，我就当上了新闻主播。

sentences.english: To have the opportunity to encounter me as a Guru is truly precious.
sentences.chinese: 能够有机缘值遇我为上师，实在是很珍贵的。

sentences.english: Their chance to go(of ging) internineis was lost.
sentences.chinese: 他们遗失了出国的机缘。
这绝不可能是机缘巧合。

sentences.english: Nankai can smoothly carry out frontier research projects, to indeed be a luck.
sentences.chinese: 南开能够顺利开展边疆研究计划，确乎是个机缘。

sentences.english: Tu Yuanyuan (Hereafter Tu): When did you visit China for the first time?
sentences.chinese: 是什么机缘促成您第一次来中国？

sentences.english: Opportunity, sooner or later, comes to all who work.
sentences.chinese: 只须努力事业而有志向，机缘迟早终会惠临。

definition: luck/fate/opportunity/the ups and downs of life
good luck/Nature (as the mother of all things)
chance/opportunity/predestined relationship/(Buddhist) principal and secondary causes/chain of cause and effect
to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
to comprehend (the nature of things etc)/to achieve enlightenment
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
